comment: Just awesome. Extremely smooth and very complex. 2014 version is amazing.
Very tasty, with good bite. Full of flavor, great floral finish.
I've tasted the 2014 release. First pour from a fresh bottle. I get mushrooms to the hilt! It's overpowering. Glad I tasted from someone else's bottle.
The best of the AE line.  Very solid juice, the way it was meant to be. Pairs well with dark cocoa.  Find it and add it to your collection.
A lot of toast and oak. Vanilla. A little hot.
Big floral nose. Smooth despite being cask strength. Worth being in the collection
Burns, but very smooth going down. Bought 3 bottles a couple weeks ago
It's good of you don't mind the burn. I haven't acquired that "skill" yet apparently.
Smooth for a bourbon with 119 ABV but still got the bite instead of the flavor notes. Wouldn't pay $120 for this personally. Nice as a treat though.

Bought the 2015 for $120
Bought the 2016 for $175
Only able to get one bottle of each for now, so no tasting notes. More to come if I can get another bottle.
Had the LE 2015 and was not a fan! Sadly left down for the price pint and did not appeal to me what's so ever

You can smell the fortified wine, the sweet notes are there. The nose smells rich, if that makes sense. Wood, vanilla, honey. The palate follows suit. Strong flavors, sweet and spicy. Great kick and warmth all the way down to the stomach. Long lingering notes. Great pour. 5/1/17
Stong fiery start. Middle is sweet wood, Toast vanilla. Long finish of spicy peppery oak.
Had this at the Akerman LA event. Maybe the best thing I ever had. As a desert bourbon.

Nose: Oak, dankness, vanilla, spice

Taste: Vanilla, heavy spice & oak

Finish: long, oak, vanilla and spice for days
sampled Sept 2017 with my bourbon tasting buddies
2016, 124.6 proof. Smells fresh, minty, and very strong cinnamon. Big Red! On the palate, some Juicy Fruit. This is like chewing those two gums at the same time. Good spice and warmth. 8/24/18

Tasting 2016 Edition.
I really wanted to love this Bourbon. However, much like the 2017 edition, I am left a little underwhelmed. The biggest drawback is that it is a little unbalanced. It's very spicy. This is apparent right upon entry, you are hit with peppery spices. As we move to the mid pallette the spice recedes a little and you get some red fruits and heavy oak. Finish is meduim and oak driven. You finally taste the port influence on the finish with the sweet drying port and red wine notes. For the price point, I would not buy this again. It's not bad but not worth the price of admission.
Citrus, vanilla, and honey flavors.  Lite mouthfeel.  Medium amber color.  Clear residue.
chocolate nose, fruit up front, mellows a tad with water but still delicious and shockingly good
Luciously heavy. A great dram for a special day.
Silky smooth. All I can say, delicious
2016 cask strength is one of my all time favorites.

Nose: tobacco, vanilla, brown sugar, ethanol
Palate: cinnamon, tobacco, oak, brown sugar
Finish: oak tannins, pepper

Nose is vanilla, sweetness, a little leather, Green apple and some light ethanol vapors.
Palate is sweet and light with some vanilla and light nuttiness and a tiny bit of Barrel. Not much depth.
The finish is short with a little bitterness, but it’s fairly smooth.
I was excited to try this port finished version, but it was just ok for me.
A little to smooth for me, the wine barrel really mellows it out. Still a good bourbon for guests.

Nose... Dutch Apple pie, caramel, chocolate, toffee and other dessert notes through and through...

Color... Light to medium mahogany..

Taste... Cherry pie, chocolate, Port wine, oats, raisins, and time..... Not thyme, but actual time...

Overall.... Just buy this. I don't need to explain it nor push it any harder. It's what you hope for if you've had the general version. This is exactly what a cask should taste like, it just truly brings out the flavor of the wood. An exceptional drink....
